channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Make it work: I was put on an interview panel and have no idea what I’m doing
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. What’s important to you in a teammate and what type of questions can you ask that will measure that? css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. As the interview unfolds, ask follow-up questions: You want to be prepared, but not rigid.
item.author: Shane Loughnane

item.title: Stock watch: May 22
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Walmart and Amazon both reported being overstaffed in Q1
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Along with higher fuel prices and an inventory glut, elevated labor costs led to a 24.8% profit decline from last year. —MK In its earnings call this week, Walmart CEO Doug McMillon said that due to a late 2021 hiring surge to cover Omicron-related staffing shortages, the company experienced weeks of overstaffing in the first quarter of this year. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! In tech, Meta announced a hiring freeze across some departments, while Uber told employees it would be “deliberate” about adding to headcount.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Massachusetts confirms first US case of monkeypox this year
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. And in terms of symptoms, it’s a whole gaggle of things you don’t want: fever, aches, swollen lymph nodes, and (the crème de la crème) painful blisters on the hands, feet, and face. Most people catch monkeypox directly from animals (though first found in monkeys, it’s usually spread by rodents) in West Africa or central Africa, and it’s pretty rare to contract it from another person. —MM Should we be worried? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Monkeypox is pretty easy to spot and track because of the sores, and it’s similar enough to smallpox that the vaccines for that disease would likely offer protection. It’s a virus that can spread through respiratory droplets and bodily fluids. What is monkeypox? At least 67 other suspected cases of the rare virus have also recently popped up in countries like the UK, Portugal, and Canada, baffling experts who have yet to uncover how the virus managed to make giant continental jumps.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: The housing market is finally chilling out
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. More signs are suggesting that the sizzling pace of US home price increases will start to ease. —NF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! But relief is on its wayThe Atlantic’s Derek Thompson identified several clues that the housing market has indeed peaked:The home inventory shortage, a leading contributor to the demand​​–supply imbalance, is starting to ease in the hottest markets, such as California and Colorado. “It looks like more declines are imminent in the upcoming months, and we’ll likely return to the pre-pandemic home sales activity after the remarkable surge over the past two years,” Lawrence Yun, the chief economist at the National Association of Realtors, said. And an average home on the market stayed there for just 17 days before going under contract. The first sign: Sales of existing homes fell 2.4% in April to their lowest level in almost two years. The housing market might be experiencing that right now.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Massachusetts confirms first US case of monkeypox this year
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. And in terms of symptoms, it’s a whole gaggle of things you don’t want: fever, aches, swollen lymph nodes, and (the crème de la crème) painful blisters on the hands, feet, and face. —MM Should we be worried? What is monkeypox? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! It’s a virus that can spread through respiratory droplets and bodily fluids. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeMassachusetts health officials said Wednesday that they detected the first US case of monkeypox this year. At least 67 other suspected cases of the rare virus have also recently popped up in countries like the UK, Portugal, and Canada, baffling experts who have yet to uncover how the virus managed to make giant continental jumps. Monkeypox is pretty easy to spot and track because of the sores, and it’s similar enough to smallpox that the vaccines for that disease would likely offer protection. Most people catch monkeypox directly from animals (but not monkeys, usually rodents) in West Africa or central Africa, and it’s pretty rare to contract it from another person.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Walmart and Amazon both reported being overstaffed in Q1
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Amazon also reported earlier this month that employees returning from sick leave led to a quick transition from being understaffed to overstaffed. Along with higher fuel prices and an inventory glut, elevated labor costs led to a 24.8% profit decline from last year. —MK In its earnings call this week, Walmart CEO Doug McMillon said that due to a late 2021 hiring surge to cover Omicron-related staffing shortages, the company experienced weeks of overstaffing in the first quarter of this year. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! In tech, Meta announced a hiring freeze across some departments, while Uber told employees it would be “deliberate” about adding headcount.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: The housing market is finally chilling out
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. More signs are suggesting that the sizzling pace of US home price increases will start to ease. —NF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! But relief is on its wayThe Atlantic’s Derek Thompson identified several clues that the housing market has indeed peaked:The home inventory shortage, a leading contributor to the demand​​–supply imbalance, is starting to ease in the hottest markets, such as California and Colorado. “It looks like more declines are imminent in the upcoming months, and we’ll likely return to the pre-pandemic home sales activity after the remarkable surge over the past two years,” Lawrence Yun, the chief economist at the National Association of Realtors, said. And an average home on the market stayed there for just 17 days before going under contract. The first sign: Sales of existing homes fell 2.4% in April to their lowest level in almost two years. The housing market might be experiencing that right now.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: School districts struggle to spend their Covid funds
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. LA in particular is still racing to spend several hundred mil left over from previous stimulus packages. —JW So what’s the hang-up? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Pay gap gets the boot in US soccer
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe US men’s and women’s soccer teams will receive the same salaries and bonuses, pool prize money for World Cup performances, and share revenue for TV and sponsorships under a landmark agreement announced by the US Soccer Federation yesterday. Men’s teams received $8 million just for qualifying for the 2018 World Cup.Looking ahead…advocates hope this agreement will fuel growth in women’s soccer around the globe. —NF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! That will likely lead to the men handing over some proceeds to the women, given the huge discrepancy in FIFA payouts between the two tournaments:When the US women won the tournament in 2019, they received a total of $4 million. The new World Cup pay arrangement is especially notable—the US’ soccer federation says it’s the first country in the world where national teams will pool their World Cup prize money and split it. After hoisting their third World Cup trophy in 2015, members of the US women’s national team (USWNT) wondered why they were bringing in less $$$ than their less successful male counterparts, and they alleged wage discrimination against US Soccer in a civil rights complaint the next year.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Tesla got booted from S&P 500 ESG index and Musk is mad
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. This particular ESG index, which is controlled by the S&P Dow Jones Indices, ranks companies in the S&P 500 based on criteria like whether or not they release sustainability reports, use renewable energy, pay fair wages to their employees, have ethical supply chains, and have a diverse board of directors, among other metrics. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeTesla has been booted from the S&P 500 ESG Index, and Elon Musk thought the decision was bad.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Tesla got booted from S&P 500 ESG index and Musk is mad
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. This particular ESG index, which is controlled by the S&P Dow Jones Indices, ranks companies in the S&P 500 based on criteria like whether or not they release sustainability reports, use renewable energy, pay fair wages to their employees, have ethical supply chains, and have a diverse board of directors, among other metrics. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeTesla has been booted from the S&P 500 ESG Index, and Elon Musk thought the decision was bad. What is ESG?
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Pay gap gets the boot in US soccer
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe US men’s and women’s soccer teams will receive the same salaries, bonuses, prize money for World Cup performances, and revenue sharing for TV and sponsorships under a landmark agreement announced by the US Soccer Federation yesterday. Since the World Cup prize money will now be split between men and women, the US men’s team will probably make less, because the discrepancy in FIFA payouts between the men’s and women’s tournaments is huge:If the men’s team makes it to the round of 16 in the World Cup in Qatar (and we’re confident they will), they’ll get a payout of $13 million. —NF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Looking ahead…advocates hope this agreement will fuel growth in women’s soccer around the globe. After hoisting their fourth World Cup trophy in 2015, members of the US women’s national team (USWNT) wondered why they were bringing in less $$$ than their less successful male counterparts, and they alleged wage discrimination against US Soccer in a civil rights complaint the next year. When the women won the entire tournament in 2019, they received a total of $4 million.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: School districts struggle to spend their Covid funds
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. LA in particular is still racing to spend several hundred mil left over from previous stimulus packages. —JW So what’s the hang-up? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!

item.title: MiamiCoin has lost 95% of its peak value
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Here’s how it works:Investors buy tokens that they can use to bid on a city’s coin. —JW What even are these coins? Why the double take? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Elon Musk further complicates Twitter deal with bot drama
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. On a recent episode…Elon Musk attempted to put the takeover on ice (for the second time) Tuesday morning, tweeting “this deal cannot move forward” unless Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal shows proof that fewer than 5% of Twitter’s accounts are fake/spam. —NF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Big picture: Musk’s hang-up with spam accounts has some analysts suggesting that he’s manufacturing outrage over bots as an excuse to renegotiate a deal he believes he paid too much for—or wants to back out of completely. If Musk rips up the agreement, he’ll owe a $1 billion breakup fee. Musk, without giving any credible evidence, has asserted that at least 20% of all Twitter accounts are fake, and maybe even 90% are. Twitter estimates that fewer than 5% of its monthly active users are fake or spam accounts, and Agrawal explained in a long thread on Monday how the company arrives at that number.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Congress held the first public hearing on UFOs in 50 years
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One previously classified video revealed Tuesday showed a spherical object speeding past a US fighter jet. That’s a big uptick from an official report published last year that included 143 such events dating back to 2004. —MK That incident, like many others, remains unexplained. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.

Big picture: Musk’s hang-up with spam accounts has some analysts suggesting that he’s manufacturing outrage over bots as an excuse to renegotiate a deal he believes he paid too much for—or wants to back out of completely. If Musk rips up the agreement, he’ll owe a $1 billion breakup fee. Musk, without giving any credible evidence, has asserted that at least 20% of all Twitter accounts are fake, and maybe even 90% are. item.title: Wildfire risk may double in the next 3 decades for most homes: report
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. But states including New Jersey, Massachusetts, Louisiana, Alabama, and Arkansas will likely see their fire risks grow more than 200% in the next 30 years. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeMost homeowners can expect their wildfire risks to double over the next three decades due to climate change, according to a new report from the nonprofit First Street Foundation. A quick summary of the findings:80 million homes have some level of wildfire risk in the next 30 years, and at least 10 million homes fall between the “major” or “extreme” risk categories. —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! You can view your home’s risk score here or on listing sites like realtor. Just yesterday, the New Mexico Calf Canyon Fire became the largest in state history after burning 298,060 acres. By 2052, 50% of the US counties that will see fire risk jump the most are in Georgia. The report included a first-of-its-kind tool to measure wildfire risk on individual properties, accounting for factors such as a home’s roof type or the vegetation near the house.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: US Covid death toll reaches 1 million, and a new subvariant is spreading fast
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe US Covid death toll officially reached 1 million in recent days, a tally greater than the combined populations of Boston and Orlando. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. US cases have jumped 60% over the past two weeks, to an average of 90,000 new cases every day.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: The debate over ‘greedflation’
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One prominent economist is taking Biden’s side... css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. President Biden also thinks price gouging is contributing to inflation. —NF Former Treasury Secretary Larry Summers, who warned early on that the government’s stimulus measures would lead to inflation, came to the government’s defense, tweeting that Jeff Bezos is “mostly wrong in his recent attack” on the Biden administration.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The debate over ‘greedflation’
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One prominent economist is taking the White House’s side. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. While Summers called the corporate price gouging narrative “preposterous,” he also said it’s reasonable to raise taxes as a means of tamping down demand and inflation. After Biden tweeted out those thoughts, Jeff Bezos felt inspired to go on the attack. —NF
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The week ahead: May 16
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. “I think one of the lessons we learned in World War II is not standing up to aggression early is a huge mistake,” McConnell said. Golf’s PGA Championship starts on Thursday (Phil Mickelson will not be playing). Consumer sentiment hit an 11-year low this month.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: NY Gov. Kathy Hochul calls on social media platforms to moderate hate speech
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Last Wednesday, an appeals court reinstated a Texas law that bans social media companies from moderating content on their platforms based on “the viewpoint of the user or another person.” But that removal would have seemingly violated Texas’s new social media law if it had occurred there. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The racist theory inspiring a wave of mass shootings
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In a 180-page document, the suspect wrote that European men were allowing themselves to be “ethnically replaced” and told people of color to “leave while you can.” css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. item.title: NY Gov. Kathy Hochul calls on social media platforms to moderate hate speech
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Last Wednesday, an appeals court reinstated a Texas law that bans social media companies from moderating content on their platforms based on “the viewpoint of the user or another person.” But that removal would have seemingly violated Texas’s new social media law if it had occurred there. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!

item.title: ‘Succession’ actor’s protest highlights the vegan upcharge
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Across the industry, the retail price of nondairy, plant-based milk is around twice the price of dairy milk, according to Mintec, which analyzes food commodity costs. But while those factors may help explain why plant-based milks are expensive, they don’t fully spell out why dairy milk is so cheap. While most people probably aren’t concerned about what the human star of Babe: Pig in the City sticks himself to, Cromwell’s glue-in highlights a reality for vegans and those with dairy allergies: Things tend to cost a lot more. The lactose intolerance taxIn January, Starbucks stores in the UK made all dairy alternatives free. But in the US, Starbucks locations typically charge an additional 70 cents for nondairy options. And it’s not just Starbucks charging a premium, either. So what’s keeping those oat milk prices high? —MK Zoom out: While around 36% of Americans are lactose intolerant (a condition that predominantly affects people of color), the US is still living in its Got Milk? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! There’s a higher demand for dairy milk—61% of US households primarily drink it, compared to the 23% that opt for plant-based—so production costs are more spread out and retail prices are cheaper. Given that the carbon footprint of cow milk is about 3x that of alternatives like oat milk, environmental advocates like Cromwell are hoping that removing cost burdens will lead to more people giving nondairy options a chance.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Make it work: How do I make myself “recession-proof”?
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It’s easy to get complacent when we have a job, especially one that’s going reasonably well. Your best bet is to focus your energy on staying positive and executing on the things that are within your control. Is there anything I can do to “recession-proof” myself? css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.
item.author: Shane Loughnane

item.title: Icebreakers with…virtual reality pioneer Louis Rosenberg
item.description: . We chatted with Rosenberg about the early days of VR and AR tech and what the heck the metaverse will actually look like. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Louis Rosenberg, the CEO and chief scientist at Unanimous AI, founded two early augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) companies and developed the first functional AR system for the Air Force in the 90s. You’ve been studying AR and VR technology since the ’90s. They currently track people and use the information to profile people and sell targeted advertising. The metaverse is going to take us from a world where Big Tech platforms, which are currently tracking where you click, track everything about your life. And I might not realize that those are virtual product placements injected into my world on behalf of a paying advertiser.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Southwest, other airlines invest in in-flight wi-fi to stay competitive
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! It’s part of a broader trend of airlines investing in faster in-air wi-fi to win over travel-hungry customers, especially now that business travel has started to rebound. But the four biggest US airlines haven’t given Starlink the time of day. A few weeks ago it announced a deal with SpaceX’s Starlink to start installing the service on some planes next year. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe airline obsessed with boarding passengers gladiator-style is spending $2 billion to give the people what they want. They have instead partnered with wi-fi provider Viasat, which Southwest will be working with to roll out better internet for passengers by the fall.
item.author: Matty Merritt
